fields.summary: Allow mean, median, sum as statistics for votes and other numeric fields

fields.description:
It is currently possible to enter negative worklog values. These values do not make sense and cause problems when the worklog is rendered and time is aggregated.

Currently negative worklog and duration (the issue's estimates and time spent) values appear as blanks (not rendered correctly) so it is difficult to see what value was actually entered.

The solution is to fix DateUtils in atlassian-core to not accept negatives and instead throw InvalidDurationEx.

To reproduce, you must use a negative number without any character type indicator ("-100" not "-100s"). The value is interpreted as a negative number of seconds.
fields.summary: Stop allowing negative worklog values being entered

fields.description: An option to vote "no" against fixes would be greatly appreciated.  JIRA is being used in quasi-democratic environments (such as SecondLife), and the lack of such a vote prevents actual opinions from being addressed.  Comments negative to issues are often not enough.  Thank you for your consideration.
fields.summary: "No" option for voting.

fields.description: When a user is first created in Jira, the admin has the option to email the password out to the user, but if the admin resets it there is no way to push that out to the user.  Might be nice if there was.
fields.summary: Option to send password by e-mail when assigning the user a new password

fields.description:
I would like to have two extra features or new plugins for the Multi User Picker and  Single Version Picker add-on.

1 - a way to block one or more fields in the picklist list to prevent to select an obsolete field.

2 - an picker list for each project and which can be edit bij the project admistrator.
fields.summary: Multi User Picker and  Single Version Picker add-on

fields.description:
Nearly all of JIRA language files have been translated to Turkish. language_tr_TR.jar and tr_TR.gif are attached. 
Also I've upload the language_tr_TR_src.tar.gz files which are used by our trainee when translating the files. language_tr_TR_src.tar.gz file contains ant script for build jar file.

I hope you would add the Turkish translation to new version of Jira.
fields.summary: JIRA Turkish Language Property Files

fields.description:
Currently it is hard-coded.  This should be pulled from external links so partners can override.

The property is {{admin.supportrequest.success.description}}
fields.summary: Make email address in Support Request success/error page configurable
Minor typo mistake in English language pack

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13245].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 2 September 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue. 

Good news - this request was successfully implemented. 

For those of you who are using the JIRA Cloud, the feature was rolled out on 24th of August. For JIRA Server users - please expect this feature to be delivered with the upgrade to JIRA 7.0 - planned to be released shortly.
 
Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.
 
Cheers,

Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

*Original request description*
 
In 3.9 JIRA introduced "Convert Issue to Sub-task" and "Convert Sub-task to Issue".
It would be handy to be able to bulk convert.
fields.summary: Bulk Convert Issues to Sub-task and back

fields.description:
When I set the Browse permission (on my 'default permission scheme') to Group(Anyone), users are correctly able to browse my projects.

However, when they click on a project, it by default puts them on the 'Open Issues' tab.  They can then click on a category or version, and then a bug, and view the bugs, and it all works just fine.

But the user who is not logged in CANNOT click any of the other tabs, if they click them it will REMAIN on the 'Open Issues' tab.  This is incorrect behavior.  When someone has browse permission, they should be able to click all other tabs and do read-only operations (such as selecting/viewing a bug).
fields.summary: Browse permission Group(Anyone) does not work properly

fields.description:
Hi,

I have just spotted a funny translation of "your watches" in French...it has been translated as " your spies" !

it should be something like " vos demandes observees".

Regards

Mel
fields.summary: "Your Watches" translated as "Your Spies" in French....

fields.description:
As a user, I don't want the column Business Value to be this wide in my list - I'd be happy to call it Bus Val.

However, when I log the ticket, I want to know that it is Business Value.

Also, it is ridiculous how the description is showed in the column header - it means that you can't use it, because you won't be able to fit other columns on the same page.

It's good to have a description, but show it on a tooltip or something.
fields.summary: Ability to define a short label for Custom Fields

fields.description:
As a user, I want to be able to sort column order and list item order.

The way Jira currently implements this is really naft - to move a recently added column to be the 3rd column in the view, I have to click the stupid left arrow 6-8 times, depending on how many columns I have.

Because the "Move right" button moves with the column, it demands more time and effort than it should for such a trivial task.
fields.summary: Ordering columns for issue navigator columns should allow to specify an arbitrary position

fields.description:
As a user, I want to be able to easily read a list of tickets on screen and printed out.

My goal is to get as many tickets onto one screen/ sheet of paper as possible.

However, as Jira currently works, the Summary is allocated a fixed width, which means that a summary like "Implementation of funds transfer" is wrapped over 3 lines in the list. This makes it very hard to read and also reduces the overview you get on one page (less items).
fields.summary: Adjustable column widths

fields.description:
As a user, I want to be able to edit values in lists in-line.

My goal is to change the business value (which determines priority) for a list of item that contains approx 20-200 items.

As Jira currently works, I will have to open up every single ticket to change the business value (custom fields) and then save it.
fields.summary: In-line editing of values

fields.description:
A customer had a problem whereby JIRA was "freezing" often.  The culprit was that the CachingVersionStore was locking people out while it populated its cache.

The admins where changing the order of a version for a single project but ALL versions for all projects where being discarded from the cache and re fetched.

(The low level problem was the the DB update was slow as well but this just made it worse.  And to make matters even worse the "re-order" versions was being do on the UI and hence the cache was
locked and re-populated multiple times in a short space of tuime.)

The CachingVersionStore could use a different locking, such as perhaps lock "striping" to based on say project key so that only parts of the Cache would be unavailable at a time and hence users need not be locked out from Issue interactions for long periods.

Of course this would only benefit people with heavy load and frequently changing project versions (and perhaps slow databases).
fields.summary: CachingVersionStore should use a better locking strategy when refreshing the cache

fields.description:
The doco on WIKI links (the popup doco) says

[file:///c:/temp/foo.txt]
[file:///z:/file/on/network/share.txt] 	

Creates a link to file on your computer or on a network share that you have mapped to a drive.

NOTE: By default, this only works on Internet Explorer but can also be enabled in Firefox (see docs). 

This is no longer true.  IE doesnt follow file: links anymore nor does FireFox.
fields.summary: The WIKI Help mentions file:/// links buit they not longer work in major browsers

fields.description: We use issue level security but lament the fact that sub-tasks inherit the security of the parent with no option to change it.  It'd be great to default the security to that of the parent, but sub-tasks should be able to have their own security level.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks should have permissions of their own

fields.description:
All JIRA issue linking assumes and "inward" and "outward" relationship between issues, i.e. one might have "is superseded by" and "supersedes" between two issues. But there are cases when one simply wants to establish a relationship between two issues without implying a direction. For example, we use "is related to". But, in order to make this work, we must define both an inward and outward relationship. So we have made both "is related to". This sort of works, except that, when linking issues, you get a pulldown menu with "is related to" listed twice. This looks rather peculiar to the users.

Looking at Atlassian's JIRA issue database, I see that you have evaded this problem by defining "is related to" and "relates to". But this is really just a hack as these two relations are apparently the same. This makes the user wonder which one s/he should pick.

In my opinion, the solution to this is for JIRA to allow the inward and outward relation to be the same when creating issue link types. This would essentially codify the concept that some issue linking is directional and some is not.
fields.summary: Issue links in the inward & outward direction should be allowed to be the same

Implement transition issue through workflow with XML-RPC

fields.description:
The portlets in the dashboard - e.g. filter statistics or 2-dimensional portlets - misses for several selections (e.g. for issue type or status) active links in the row and column headers. This is as well in your JIRA installation.

I see that you have moved the links to the row and columns totals but this solution is not as intuitive usable as the solution before especially when you are not displaying the totals.
fields.summary: Missing active row and columns links in dashboard portlets

fields.description:
it looks like the JRE we are bundling is missing the server\jvm.dll file because it is stripped down.

we should rather strip out the client jvm if anything.
fields.summary: JIRA installer ships with client JRE instead of server JRE

fields.description:
Feature comparison at: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/comparison.jsp
states that Project email addressing (Individual emails for each project.) is available only in Enterprise.

But it is currently available in all editions.
(and may not work correctly in all editions)
fields.summary: Project email addressing available across all JIRA versions

fields.description:
standard/controlfooter.jsp always closes the row with the </tr> tag, however standard/controlfooter.jsp does not open the row (<tr>) if the nolabel param is set, as a result causes a malformed HTML.

This is reproduceable on the Bulk Edit User Members page as it has:
{code:html}
<ui:component name="'usersToAssignStr'" value="usersToAssignStr" template="multiuserpicker.jsp">
    <ui:param name="'nolabel'" value="'true'"/>
    <ui:param name="'style'" value="''"/>
</ui:component>
{code}

This can be fixed by adding a check to the controlfooter.jsp as it is done in controlheader.jsp.
But the proper fix would involve moving the multiuserpicker.jsp to the single theme instead of the standard theme
fields.summary: controlfooter.jsp always closes the html tr tag even when the nolabel param is set

fields.description:
Make the hidden comments trim long texts like the way it is done for linked issues summary (See [JRA-13102]).

The difference is that the hidden comments currently trim at a word level (ie. if the last word does not fit, remove the whole word), where as the linked issues summary are trimmed at a character level (ie. if the last word does not fit, include as much as it can).
fields.summary: Improve hidden comments text trimming

fields.description:
Linked issues show the priority field column even if the priority field is hidden.

Steps to reproduce:
# Enable Issue Linking
# Create a new link
# Create 2 Issues
# Link issue 1 to issue 2
# Hide the priority field
# View issue 1
fields.summary: Hide the priority of linked issues if the priority field is hidden

fields.description:
You select the lead for a component in the Edit Component screen, but then you have go back to the project and click on the 'Select assignee for components' to change whether this lead gets issues assigned by default or not.

It would be more logical if all the configuration for a component, including the default assignee for that component, was on the one page.
fields.summary: Component assignee selection should be on Edit Component screen

fields.description: Error when editing User Is In Group Custom Field Condition in workflow - Groups List is empty. This bug exists because in template isuseringroupcf-condition-edit-params.vm used velocity params "groups" & "group" instead of "groupcfs" & "groupcf"
fields.summary: Error when editing User Is In Group Custom Field Condition in workflow

fields.description: It is not possible to specify the field "Security Level" in a filter. It would be very important for us to search all issues of a specified security level.
fields.summary: Cannot search for Security Level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13221].
  {panel}

In our project we have too many components for our different projects. Right now we are using jira version 3.6.2, but we are going to upgrade to 3.10.1. 
I was wondering if it is possible in the later Jira versions to have scroll down as it is in 3.6.2, but that you also can search on the component by typing as well?

I was checking out the Release Notes for 3.10 (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+3.10+Release+Notes#JIRA3.10ReleaseNotes-browsing) and read under the heading "Auto-complete user picker and issue picker". 
Is it possible to do something similar for components? (see attachment)
When creating an issue, if you know the name of the component, why scroll down, when you can type in the first letters and pinpoint it out right away? It would be valuable timesaver for our customers and save some time for our developers as well. 

Thanks in advance!
P.O
fields.summary: Search picker for components

fields.description:
The integrity checker will crash if the PortletConfiguration data has invalid data (ironic I know)

In PortletCheck the code

{code]
    protected boolean shouldPortletBeDeleted(String entityIdStr) throws GenericEntityException
    {
        Long entityId = new Long(entityIdStr);
        GenericValue entity = ofBizDelegator.findByPrimaryKey(getPropertyEntity(), EasyMap.build("id", entityId));
        return (entity == null);
    }
{code}

blindly accepts an entity id as a string and assumes it on Long format.  If its not or "" empty string then BANG!

The customers data had empty string for a PortletConfiguration projectId.  

{code]
mysql> select * from propertyentry, propertystring where propertyentry.id = propertystring.id and property_key = 'projectId';
+-------+----------------------+-----------+--------------+--------------+-------+---------------+
| ID    | ENTITY_NAME          | ENTITY_ID | PROPERTY_KEY | propertytype | ID    | propertyvalue |
+-------+----------------------+-----------+--------------+--------------+-------+---------------+
| 11550 | PortletConfiguration |     10095 | projectid    |            5 | 11550 | 10061         | 
| 11552 | PortletConfiguration |     10096 | projectid    |            5 | 11552 | 10060         | 
| 11563 | PortletConfiguration |     10111 | projectid    |            5 | 11563 | 10061         | 
| 11565 | PortletConfiguration |     10112 | projectid    |            5 | 11565 | 10060         | 
| 11620 | PortletConfiguration |     10133 | projectId    |            5 | 11620 |               | 
| 11617 | PortletConfiguration |     10132 | projectid    |            5 | 11617 | 10070         | 
| 11863 | PortletConfiguration |     10246 | projectid    |            5 | 11863 | 10061         | 
| 11873 | PortletConfiguration |     10248 | projectid    |            5 | 11873 | 10060         | 
| 12019 | PortletConfiguration |     10301 | projectid    |            5 | 12019 | 10073         | 
| 12120 | PortletConfiguration |     10331 | projectid    |            5 | 12120 | 10060         | 
| 12448 | PortletConfiguration |     10429 | projectid    |            5 | 12448 | 10061         | 
| 12450 | PortletConfiguration |     10430 | projectid    |            5 | 12450 | 10060         | 
| 12703 | PortletConfiguration |     10512 | projectid    |            5 | 12703 | 10072         | 
+-------+----------------------+-----------+--------------+--------------+-------+---------------+
13 rows in set (0.01 sec)

{code}

The integrity check  should have more integrity :)  

The code should look for null values and other invalid id values.  Happens on 3.9.1 and 3.11 HEAD
fields.summary: IntegrityChecker crashes with missing Portlet data.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13218].
  {panel}

The issue navigator can not be order/filter by the new aggregate fields (time spent, original estimate, remaining estimate & progress) added in 3.11.
It would be nice to be able to order by these fields.

Due to permissions, you can not calculate these aggregates during issue indexing as you may not be able to see some of the sub-tasks and they will be different for users with different permissions.  Therefore, if we wanted to filter or order by these fields we would have to calculate it at run time for all issues in the database.
As these fields are calculated by running another Lucene search, a system with 30K issues in would run 30001 Lucene queries for every search done.

Another way to solve this problem is to build a report which would take in a saved filter and the aggregate fields to sort by and do the expensive operation.  Not the perfect solution, but it may satisfy the needs of some.

For the time being, you will need to export your results to Excel and then do a sort/filter in there.

If you are voting for this issue, please let us know if you would be happy with the report.
fields.summary: Order/filter by Aggregate Time Tracking fields in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
When searching for a fix version and/or component and clciking View & Hide, the left hand form shows the description of a search. For example, Project: JIRA, Fix For Version: 3.11. The Fix For Version parameter and Components parameter are not linked to the respective Browse pages. They should be. For an example see how the Project field is linked.

Please ensure that we test:
# That only the Fix For Version field is linked, i.e. the Affected Versions field and Version and Multi-Version Custom Fields are NOT linked. The reason for this is that the Browse page is really a Browse Fix For Version page
# That "Any" and "No Fix Version" options are NOT linked, as there is nothing to link them to
fields.summary: The search description does not link to Browse Fix For Version and Browse Component page when searching versions or components
Add more specific database permissions needed for JIRA setup

fields.description:
Replication Instructions:
# Use FireFox (e.g. v. 1.5.0.10)
# Log into JIRA
# Open any saved filter
# Click Edit (to edit filter)
# Go to Filters (upper right-hand corner) and right-click to "Open Link in a New Tab"
# In that second tab, pick any *other* saved filter # Go back to first 
tab 
# Click on View (the link next to "Filter: " above the edit pane,  not the View >> button).
# Notice that the second filter will be opened in this tab, replacing 
the filter you were using before
fields.summary: JIRA does not support some tabbed browsing in FireFox

fields.description:
Description for the "Delete Issues" permission in the Permission Schemes is "Ability to delete issues, comments and attachments". I think this is inaccurate since the changes to separate permissions for comments and attachments?

By the way (sidenote) JRA-4995 can probably be closed due to these updates also.
fields.summary: Description in "Delete Issues" permission is inaccurate

fields.description:
To replicate:

Login with a user who does not have permission to create issues in ANY projects, but who has the "Move Issues" permission. View an issue and select the "Move" operation and the attached error message is displayed.
fields.summary: moveissue.step1.desc in "Move Issue" error message
ability to specify day ranges in business days instead of calendar days
Add report to calculate Time Spent between specified dates

fields.description:
I have created a permission scheme in Jira but I am experiencing an odd behaviour.

I have 5 users in Jira and in the permission scheme, the Browse Projects is assigned to:

- Project Lead 
- Project Role (Administrators) 
- Project Role (Clients) 

Among the 5 users, 3 fit these categories. One is a project lead, one is an adminstrator and the other has been added to the Clients project role.

The 2 remaining users, one has nothing to do with the project (no issues assigned to him and no other permission that would allow him to browse the project) and the other has an issue assigned to him. I want the latter to be able to browse the project, so I added Current Assignee to the Browse Projects permission. After doing that, both users are now able to browse the project. I was expecting only one.

Very similar JRA-8950
fields.summary: "Current Assignee" on Browse Permission problem

fields.summary: Full content Word export from Issue navigator duplicates wiki style table

fields.description:
I need to have the ability to set the working days other than the default.

For example we (in Israel) do not work on Fridays but we DO work on Sundays.
In addition, we have our holidays which should consider as non working days while several other holidays which might be considered as a non working days are totally regular working days for us.

The meaning of lacking this feature is that I cannot keep accurate track of the time it takes to handle a bug reported to my Jira.
This makes the Jira less useful for our needs as a utility that supports project management.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status - 24/June/2010}

Since GreenHopper now serves most of this functionality with regards to tracking time and reporting this information, we will not tackle this issue against in core JIRA, but recommend users to look at GreenHopper.

GreenHopper (5.0) currently allows you to track non-working days (now defaulted to Saturday and Sunday) and takes those into account for reporting purposes. The ability to choose other days of the week as non-working days is currently an open feature request in GreenHopper. Please track this at GHS-806.

{panel}
fields.summary: Need the ability to change default working days.

fields.description:
In a scenario when a user wants to install JIRA as the service by executing service.bat and there is no JAVA_HOME, JDK or JRE installed in Windows (clean installation), the service can't start. 
 
I think, the problem is related to a value (*auto*) that in this scenario is assigned to a JVM key. It is stored in HLM\SOFTWARE\Apache Software Foundation\Procrun 2.0\JIRA<set of digits>\Parameters\Java and it should point to jvm.dll from <JIRA home path>\jre\ or from JAVA_HOME if defined. Although, in the bat file the validation of JVM is done in the following way:
{noformat}
rem Set the server jvm from JAVA_HOME
set PR_JVM=%JAVA_HOME%\jre\bin\server\jvm.dll
if exist "%PR_JVM%" goto foundJvm
rem Set the client jvm from JAVA_HOME
set PR_JVM=%CURRENT_DIR%\jre\bin\client\jvm.dll
if exist "%PR_JVM%" goto foundJvm
rem Check for JRockit JVM: Bugzilla 39674
set PR_JVM=%JAVA_HOME%\jre\bin\jrockit\jvm.dll
if exist "%PR_JVM%" goto foundJvm
set PR_JVM=auto
{noformat}
so we finish up with JVM the vaule auto which can't "find" any JVM.

Attached log file from a test the failed installation of the service.
fields.summary: windows service installation script (service.bat) doesn't set the service correctly for JVM

fields.description:
Browsing for non-existent versions within a project produces inconsistent results. Most commonly it will throw a NPE.

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA/fixforversion/1
boom!

it will also 500 with any number of digits up to:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA/fixforversion/11111111111111111111
which will simply go to the Browse Project screen (same as if there is no fix version specified).

We need to handle this properly. VersionContextImpl should not be able to be built with a null version, and the validation in the action should return a nice error page.

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.versionpanel.VersionContextImpl.getProject(VersionContextImpl.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.model.VersionHelper.(VersionHelper.java:17)
	at _jsp._secure._views._browser._browseversion__jsp._jspService(_browseversion__jsp.java:272)
	at com.caucho.jsp.JavaPage.service(JavaPage.java:60)
        ...
{noformat}
fields.summary: Easy NPE in Browse Version

fields.description: Screenshot from Roy
fields.summary: show Server ID field on the 'Setup Wizard' page

fields.description:
I have a filter that includes the custom field "Days since last comment" (from the Toolkit). All comments are set to security for group "Staff. When displayed on screen, in issue navigator, the value is displaying correctly. But when the staff members receive a filter subscription, the value is not displaying correctly. I think it goes back to the last comment that was visible to all users.

So, when they receive the email it shows last commented 8 weeks ago when there have been numerous comments in the past few days. It is misleading. I am logging the issue here rather than JTOOL because the problem is with the filter subscription logic, and not with the custom field itself (which displays correctly in issue navigator).
fields.summary: Days since last comment field not displayed correctly in filter subscription e-mail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13193].
  {panel}

For part-time developers we use timesheet-based billing scheme.
It will be very useful if managers could approve worklog items. Then they could calculate billable time for delevopers at the end of the month.
Now we use timesheet portlet: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/Timesheet+report+and+portlet
Optimally it should be per day approvement.

For example, manager bulk sets custom field, e.g. "approved up to", and after that developer can't add/edit worklogs with earlier date.

May be you'll suggest another convenient decision...
fields.summary: WorkLog approvement for project managers
Ability to Edit filter's Column Order for pre-defined and shared filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13191].
  {panel}

*Problem*
We need an ease way to change "Preset Filters" on the Browse Project page.
We also need to be able to change what columns to show,  the order of the columns and the sorting of the issues.

*Current "solution"*
We know it is possible to change "Preset Filters" with Web Fragment plugins. *But* it is a lot of work - it requires a java programmer - and it is not possible to select/reorder columns.

*Suggested solution*
Under "Share Current Filter" it should be possible to select "Show in Preset Filters for Browse Project". 
Current "Preset Filters" should also be shown here, so it is possible to customise them.

*Other suggestions*
When searching/filtering, it should be possible to search for "current project" (if a project is currently chosen) - just as you can search for "current user" - it would make reuse of filters much simpler.

*Additional benefits*
With this solution it would be possible to use "Preset filers" in "Single Level Group By Report" as requested in JRA-12440 and JRA-8811.

*Other related issues*
JRA-8375 Allow Global saved filters to be used as a preset filter on the Browse Project page
JRA-1639 Merge saved/global filters with "preset filters"
JRA-11604 Allow to create/modify/remove preset filters on the Browse Project page through the web
JRA-10942 Allow 'Preset Filters' in 'browse project' and 'project portlets' to have pluggable links to filters
fields.summary: Preset filters should be easy to change/customise/reuse

fields.description:
If you put a URL like http://www.example.com/xyz- into a description file or comment then the traling - is truncated from the URL link.  The actual displayed part is correct however the href part is truncated.

We should encode the URL link not truncate the invalid URL characters.  In fact - is not an invalid URL char anyway so I am not sure exactly whats going on here.

I confirmed it happens on 3.8 and 3.10.

This is described in the support request https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-14253
fields.summary: Trailing + characters are truncuated from URLS in the Description / Environment / Comment fields.
Show Total in Caption of "Filter Statistics" portlet
Setting "Number of users displayed per page" in View Preferences

fields.description:
I can filter by Full Name in User Picker, but cannot in User Browser.
Each time has to recall user's email. :(
fields.summary: Filter by "Full Name"  in User Browser

fields.description:
I ran a FogBugz import with thousands of issues and at end of import an error occurred and the log says this:

09:02:08] FAILED: Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data maybe in an unstable state


There are several problems:

1. This needs to be more prominent.  Users need to know very clearly what's wrong.
2. No rollback.  After importing thousands of cases where some failed, I have no recourse except to restore a backup of the JIRA database to try again.  JIRA should support rollback of the import (by deleting the cases is fine or even by backing up the JIRA db before and restoring it afterwards).
fields.summary: Failed FogBugz import should not leave database in an "unstable state"

fields.description:
My FogBugz import failed and this is shown on the top of the page:


FogBugz import completed with errors
The importer has completed with some errors. You can find the errors in the logs below by searching for lines which begin with FAILED. It is likely that the import was not correctly configured.


The text "It is likely that the import was not correctly configured." should read "It is possible that the import was not correctly configured.".  But really, it should check what type of exceptions were generated and handle it accordingly.  Ideally a link to Atlassian's own JIRA installation searching on the exceptions would be user friendly and relatively easy to implement.

The exception I actually got was

[08:59:50] Only new Issues will be imported
[09:02:08] FAILED: Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data maybe in an unstable state
[09:02:08] com.atlassian.jira.external.ExternalRuntimeException: java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException: geostd8
	at com.atlassian.jira.external.ExternalUtils.getTextDataFromMimeMessage(ExternalUtils.java:922)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.fogbugz.transformer.CommentTransformer.transform(CommentTransformer.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.DatabaseConnectionBean.queryDb(DatabaseConnectionBean.java:271)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.DatabaseConnectionBean.queryDb(DatabaseConnectionBean.java:252)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.fogbugz.transformer.IssueTransformer.transform(IssueTransformer.java:208)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.DatabaseConnectionBean.queryDb(DatabaseConnectionBean.java:271)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.DatabaseConnectionBean.queryDb(DatabaseConnectionBean.java:252)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.fogbugz.FogBugzDataBean.getIssues(FogBugzDataBean.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.fogbugz.FogBugzDataBean.getIssuesIterator(FogBugzDataBean.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:430)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:120)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.ImporterThread.run(ImporterThread.java:21)
Caused by: java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException: geostd8
	at sun.nio.cs.StreamDecoder.forInputStreamReader(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.InputStreamReader.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at com.sun.mail.handlers.text_plain.getContent(text_plain.java:64)
	at javax.activation.DataSourceDataContentHandler.getContent(Unknown Source)
	at javax.activation.DataHandler.getContent(Unknown Source)
	at javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart.getContent(MimeBodyPart.java:603)
	at com.atlassian.jira.external.ExternalUtils.getCleanedContent(ExternalUtils.java:956)
	at com.atlassian.jira.external.ExternalUtils.getTextDataFromMimeMessage(ExternalUtils.java:938)
	at com.atlassian.jira.external.ExternalUtils.getTextDataFromMimeMessage(ExternalUtils.java:918)


Which is JIRA missing an encoding and not a configuration problem and not a user error.  It's also something JIRA could easily clean up and present to the user in a friendly way (i.e., "Case ID's x, y, and z where not imported because their attachments use encoding geostd8 and that encoding is not supported.  To search Atlassian's support for information on adding adding this encoding _click here_."
fields.summary: Don't blame users for JIRA exceptions:  It is likely that the import was not correctly configured.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13178].
  {panel}

Setting up JIRA for first time I read the docs on how to configure pop support for creating issues and created a user just for e-mail based issues.  However, after several tests no issues were created.  The logs showed this error:

2007-07-20 13:58:33,953 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-2 WARN [service.util.handler.CreateIssueHandler] Sender is anonymous, no default reporter specified and creating users is set to false (or external user managment is enabled). Message rejected.
2007-07-20 14:02:34,500 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-0 ERROR [atlassian.jira.workflow.SimpleWorkflowManager] Error occurred while creating issue.
[InvalidInputException: [Error map: [{}]] [Error list: [[User 'email' doesn't have the 'Create Issue' permission]]]
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.AbstractPermissionValidator.hasUserPermission(AbstractPermissionValidator.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.PermissionValidator.validate(PermissionValidator.java:67)
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.verifyInputs(AbstractWorkflow.java:1331)
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.transitionWorkflow(AbstractWorkflow.java:1022)
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.initialize(AbstractWorkflow.java:618)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.SimpleWorkflowManager.createIssue(SimpleWorkflowManager.java:189)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:365)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:313)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.util.profiling.object.ObjectProfiler.profiledInvoke(ObjectProfiler.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:28)
	at $Proxy5.createIssue(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateIssueHandler.handleMessage(CreateIssueHandler.java:197)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateOrCommentHandler.handleMessage(CreateOrCommentHandler.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.run(MailFetcherService.java:190)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:61)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)


Which very clearly showed the problem and I was able to fix it.  HOWEVER, the PopService configuration really should have checked permissions on the supplied user beforehand and told me when I set up the service that it wouldn't work and not force me to look through logs.
fields.summary: PopService setup should validate user permissions to ensure issues can be created via e-mail
RPC call for 'impersonating' another user

fields.description: We need to move the searchers away from the ThreadLocalQueryProfilingFilter and ensure that we proberly close them for all requests.
fields.summary: Separate out the searchers from the ThreadLocalQueryProfilingFilter

fields.description:
Currently the searchers are closed via the JIRAProfilingFilter.  The problem is that this filter is not mapped to /dwr/*, which gets invoked by the ajax issue picker.  This results in searchers being leaked, which end up holding references to index files on the disk, which causes indexing exceptions when re-indexing all issues (particularly when it comes to deleting index files).

This issue only affects JIRA 3.10, in which the issue picker was first implemented.

For a quick fix for JIRA 3.10.1, we should call ThreadLocalQueryProfiler.resetSearchers from teh RequestCleanupFitler, to ensure searchers will be closed for all requests.  In the long run (JIRA 3.11) we should move the searchers from teh ThreadLocalQueryProfiler to another class.

The workaround for this problem at the moment is to restart JIRA and re-index your JIRA instance.
fields.summary: Ajax issue picker leaks searchers in threadlocal variable which results in index exceptions on windows when re-indexing
MailingListCompiler uses ProjectRole name internally, should use ID

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13169].
  {panel}

The current ViewVC intergration does not work well with ViewVC versions 1.03 and 1.04.

The URLs used lack the view=markup attribute and hence pages get servered as binary content instead of text/html

The support request JSP-14297 explaians it well.

I have done some prelim testing on ViewVC 1.0.3 and 1.0.4 and the "revision" link generated is the most "problematic"
fields.summary: ViewVC intergration should have be in markup mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13167].
  {panel}

It is impossible to change the ordering of fields, other than custom fields, for the *View Issue* screen.  When I searched on documentation on how to put the _description_ field in front of the _attachments_ block, I noticed that other users have got the exact same request.  Currently, the description field can only be moved by changing the {{viewissue.jsp}} page.

I think that the ordering of the *View Issue* screen should be maintained as much as possible, leaving out the fields that are already in the _Issue Details_ section.

A note in the *Associating Screens with Issue Operations* section of the documentation says:

bq. The "View Issue" operation only allows one to control the layout of custom fields in the middle of the "View Issue" page. The "View Issue" page ignores all the non-custom fields on the Screen.
fields.summary: Configurable ordering of the fields in the view issue screen

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian-developers,

when I try to move an subtask into another project, the first step is to choose whether to change the issue type or change parent.

I choose "change issue type" and then there is an empty dropdown-box. I think the empty dropdown is there because I have only one issue type for subtasks. So no other one can be choosen to change. In projects where I have other sub-task issue types the problem doesn't exist.

It's an reproducable bug.

Possible Solution:
There should be a query in the code whether there is another issue type left that the subtask can be changed to. If there is no one a message should pop-up or the option "change issue type" should not be available.

Cheers,
Irene
fields.summary: Empty dropdown box when trying to move subtask and changing Issue Type

fields.description:
calendar-tr.js file doesnt contain Calendar._SDN array. 
Fixed file is attached to issue
fields.summary: Calendar Turkish Lang File Cause JavaScript Error
Link to attachment in notification emails

fields.description:
As commented on by another user in JRA-13151, the 2D portlet behaviour has _also_ changed, in that when displaying issues by assignee, it is no longer possible to click on the user name (the place people tend to click and have since forever) to get all issues assigned to that person. _If_ the user has chosen to show totals (which is totally optional), they could click on the total to get that information, but it is far to the right of the name (and hence not good U.I.). In fact, many times, the name and total won't even be on the same screen due to the need for horizontal scrolling. See my screenshot, attached.

This is even worse than the linked issue, IMO.
fields.summary: 2d Portlet loss of functionality to select row

fields.description: See linked issue.
fields.summary: Change renewal hyperlink to use new website redirects

fields.description:
Lucene 2.x  addresses some of the performance issues regarding parallel read and write access to the lucene index.
Therefore we would like to see upgrading the lucene subsystem to Lucene 2.x.
fields.summary: Upgrade to Lucene 2.x

fields.description: Allow an event to notify administrators or certain users when a new user has registered/created a JIRA account.  This would be very helpful in proactively assigning security roles and we as ensuring unauthorized users are not applying for access.
fields.summary: User Creation Notification

fields.description:
It would be useful to have a page in JIRA that listed all the Components in a Project (not Issues broken down by Component) , with their Name and full Description, visible to all users and not just administrators. This would let users familiarize themselves with all the Components, so they know which to assign their bugs to.

Right now, the only place this seems exposed is in the Add/Edit Issue pages. The "Component/s:" list lists them by name, and if you hover, it shows a tooltip with the Name and a truncated Description. Good as a memory jogger, but not a good overview to show developers and testers new to the project. The only other place I can find the Component Description text is in the Edit Component page, which is only visible to project admins and only shows one component at a time.
fields.summary: List of all Components with Name and Description

fields.description:
For the browse project, browse version and browse component pages and the 2D stats report and portlet as well as the single level group-by report, the names of the following domain entities should link to the relevant issue navigator search (consistent with JIRA version 3.9):

* component
* version
* status
* assignee
* priority 

This issue was originally raised as specific to the assignee and has since been broadened to incorporate the whole scope of the set of changes to these links made as a part of the 3.10 feature _browse components and versions_.

In the browse project page, clicking on an assignee used to show all issues assigned to that person (v3.9). Now (v3.10) it shows the user profile. How often does someone in the Browse Project page want to see a user's profile? Like .0001 % of the time?

Now I see the screen has been totally revamped forcing users to click on the tiny link with the number instead of the larger link with the status, name, etc.
fields.summary: Revert to 3.9 behaviour for stats page links for: Assignee, Version, Component, etc.

fields.description:
When viewing an issue, if you click on the "sort order" arrow on the right side when viewing say the comments, 
then click on the "printable" link at the top next to "Issue details", the printable view does not respect that sort order 
selected on the normal view. Also, but in the same vane, we changed the default sort order in the jira properties 
and the printable view is not respecting that setting.
Browsing through the code, I saw that the printable view is done completely differently from the normal Issue View and 
did not see a quick and easy way to correct the problem.
fields.summary: Printable issue view not respecting sort order

fields.description:
The Bugzilla importer prompts the user for project keys. If the user enters the key of an existing issue, JIRA goes ahead and creates another project with the same key:

{code:sql}
mysql> select pname,pkey from project;
+--------------+------+
| pname        | pkey |
+--------------+------+
| Test Project | TP   | 
| ABC          | TP   | 
+--------------+------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)
{code}
fields.summary: Bugzilla importer does not check if entered key is already used by a project
BugzillaImportBean defines commaSeparate() method that can be replaced by StringUtils.join()

fields.description: *BugzillaImportBean* has *connBean* and *importBean* members that are declared static. This is not thread-safe. If two people were importing from Bugzilla at the same time they could come to an invalid state and import corrupted data.
fields.summary: BugzillaImportBean
Add tests for CustomFieldUtils
Extend JIRA's system-webresources-plugin to offer all framework components

fields.description:
With more and more open source projects using JIRA, I'd like to have the ability to link issues together.

For example

http://jira.jboss.org/jira/browse/JBWS-1746

should be linked to

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CXF-817

I only want to look at JBWS-1746 to know whether CXF-817 has been resolved
fields.summary: Link issues across jira instances

fields.description:
I developed a simple text renderer that does nothing more than wrapping the comment text into <pre> tags. The renderer is correctly recognized by JIRA.

However, when I want to change the comment field to use the renderer, I get the following error:
---
Errors
"Tried to add a renderer type: fixed-text-renderer that is not know to the system.
---

Steps to repeat (fresh install):
* Copy plug-in (attached to this bug report) into edit-webapp/WEB-INF/lib
* Build, deploy & start server
* Complete setup wizard
* Log in as admin
* Go to Administration -> Field Configuration
* Click on 'Configure' for the default configuration
* Click on 'Renderers' for the comment field
* Select 'Fixed-Width Text Renderer' and click 'Update'
* Confirm update
=> Error
fields.summary: Cannot add a custom text renderer plugin
Provide VelocityManager.existsTemplate( String )

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13140].
  {panel}

Jira customization sometimes requires to modify Jira property files, like we can see at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Translating+JIRA or like this is the case when installing some specific plugIns.

However, when upgrading the Jira product, such customizations are overwritten, and must be carefully applied again, one by one, which unfortunately increases the cost of a product upgrade.

Here is a very simple idea that would allow Jira administrators to customize product properties with flawless upgrade:

. under WEB-INF folder, add a new folder dedicated for resources customization. Let's call it 'config'. The structure of that folder will have to follow the package arborescence implemented in Jira.

. when we want to customize a property of a property file, then we place a properties file with the same name and arborescence of the original one, but containing only the customized property, not the unchanged ones

When the JIra engine is loading properties/resources, it proceeds as usual, and, finally, loads the ones from that 'config' folder, then overriding the system properties.

The benefits are:
. Customization are localized in the 'config' folder, not mixed with default settings
. When upgrading, this folder is not overwritten, and we can easily use it on other installations.

That technic could also be used for templates, where only the complete file would be overriden.
fields.summary: Ensure seemless upgrade for customized properties
Need to add more tests for BulkMove

fields.description:
The source release via the jira:sourcerelease maven goal builds a zip file with the JIRA source.  We incorrectly added the releaseInfo=Source variable to the jira:sourcerelease goal, which actually has no effect whatsoever, since the release.info file only gets created when the war is built.

If a customer takes the source release zip and simply runs maven war:war the release.info file wont get created (the releaseInfo variable isn't set) and JIRA will show 'unknown' rather than 'Source'. We need to somehow default the release.info to 'Source' for the war:war build.
fields.summary: Source release build needs to specify the 'Source' release info by default

fields.description:
On this page:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/crowd.html

... the link with the following title:
'Integrating JIRA with Crowd',

...references a page that looks like it has been renamed.  Confluence is able to guess the correct one, so not a big deal, but a little untidy.

It's looking for http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/4.6+-+Integrating+Crowd+with+JIRA
instead of:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/3.2.4+Integrating+Crowd+with+Atlassian+JIRA

I don't know if there are some existing conventions for the documentation links, but if pages are being renamed, you may want to reference them with their tinyurls?
fields.summary: Wrong link in Jira docs
Wiki recognition for description of Version and Component

fields.description: IBM "i5 OS" is a new name for IBM OS/400. i5 OS does have good Java support, so you would think it could run Confluence Standalone. It has a "Unix-like" shell environment called "qshell". However i5 OS is not a Unix operating system, and qshell does not have all the commands and programs that a full Unix environment has. It will not run Tomcat's bin/startup.sh script.
fields.summary: CLONE -IBM i5 incompatibility

fields.description:
We are using several workflows and issue types with Jira to manage several processes like ChangeRequests, Escalations, HotFixes, Request for Enhancements, etc...
Very often, links are created between different issue types. By example when a user needs to make a Link between an HotFix request and a ChangeRequest, the complete list of all possible Issue Link types are proposed, although most of them are not applicable. This leads to lot of confusion, and users are chosing the wrong link.

The idea would be to filter out the Issue Links type list based on the Type of the current issue. By example, in a HotFix issue, only links starting from a HotFix would be proposed (taking the best between inward and outward, instead of listing both links which is also confusing).

In term of configuration, the IssueLinks would contain two new fields: Source Type and Destination Type, proposing the list of Issue Types. The default value would be 'Any' to allow generic links and upward compability.
fields.summary: Issue Linking: need to filter out Link types by Issue Type

fields.description:
We use the Project Roles to set up typically one, occasionally two, person (out of a group of around 20 people) a "Project Administration" role. 

It is quite a paint to get an overview of who is doing what. (In contrast to the jira project browser which shows you who is the project lead is - which is useful).

See screen shot for more details.
fields.summary: Improve "View Usage for Project Role" screen to get an overview of all projects without having to click on lots of links

fields.description:
It should be nice to be able to archive very old resolved/closed issues automatically. What does it mean 'very old' should be configurable on per project basis. A very nice example is your own Jira: there are more than 11000 issues for project Jira and a lot of old/resolved/duplicated issues is returned as serach results and so on. Additionaly, there are many very old unresolved bugs, which are lost in huge amount of issues. The goal of suggested feature is to give more transparency for projec managers, developers and other users. There are some additional suggestions (maybe "usage rules") about this functionality:

# Only resolved issue can be archived.
# Archived issues are ignored in search results/filters by default.
# Issues can be archived manually.
# There is configurable "issue age treshold" for each project specifying how much time after last resolution of issue it will be archived. Maybe 2 years is a reasonable default.
fields.summary: Archiving too old closed issues

fields.description:
Every time I click +Filters/History+ link I have to resize the window.
With long list of filters/issues default size of both windows does not fit.

*Other problem with these windows:* If I leave them open under the main window,
clicking +History/Filters/Help+ does not pop them up.
It's confusing.

*Question:* Why for charts generation Window (+Charts+ link from Issue Navigator page) do you use another mechanizm - "modal" window in the same Browser Window not opening new one?
fields.summary: Save position and size of Filter/History/Help pop up windows
New "External Group Management" setting distinct from "External User Management"

this is the Browse Projects link on the top navigation bar (HOME | BROWSE PROJECT | FIND ISSUES | CREATE NEW ISSUE | ADMINISTRATION)

fields.description:
When I enclose a very long text between \{noformat\} and click on Preview
I can not reach the Editor mode button any more because the scrollbar stop too early
See the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Problem with scrollbar of the Wiki redering preview.

fields.description:
I had an issue that was accidentally assigned to the main Jira Admin user.  From what I can tell from the emails I received, it caused an email to be sent to the admin user notifying them that they were assigned.  The admin user must have automatically replied with a comment along the lines of

JIRA Admin commented on ACIS-5816:
----------------------------------

    [ http://jira.coemergence.com/jira//browse/ACIS-5816?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#action_59779 ] 

This caused an endless loop of email, comment, email, comment.  It eventually locked JIRA.  I was able to fix it by ultimately deleting the issue directly from the DB.
fields.summary: Assigning a bug to the main Admin user causes an email/commenting loop that locked up JIRA.

fields.description: typo "reconmmended" on page http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.10/configure.html (CAPTCHA on signup section)
fields.summary: Typo in documentation

fields.description:
It would be great to have a custom field that can be backed up by a list of values derived from column(s) in a database table.  Ideally when you are adding the field you would be asked for driver/connection details or a jndi reference.

You could then just type the sql statement to select the values for a drop down list.  You would need to tell the field which is the key to store and what is it's display name.  When a value is selected, its key is stored.

This would open up Jira to all manner of new possibilities.
fields.summary: Database table backed custom field
